comment.shortText: Create and return a [Set](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Set) that triggers rerenders when it's updated.
Iterates over values in the set.

mdx.rawBody: Iterates over values in the set.

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: Iterates over values in the set.

comment.shortText: Returns an iterable of [v,v] pairs for every value `v` in the set.

mdx.rawBody: Returns an iterable of [v,v] pairs for every value `v` in the set.

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: Returns an iterable of [v,v] pairs for every value `v` in the set.
markdownRemark.html: Returns an iterable of [v,v] pairs for every value v in the set.

comment.shortText: Despite its name, returns an iterable of the values in the set,

mdx.rawBody: Despite its name, returns an iterable of the values in the set,

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: Despite its name, returns an iterable of the values in the set,
markdownRemark.html: Despite its name, returns an iterable of the values in the set,

comment.shortText: Returns an iterable of values in the set.

mdx.rawBody: Returns an iterable of values in the set.

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: Returns an iterable of values in the set.
markdownRemark.html: Returns an iterable of values in the set.

Create and return a Set that triggers rerenders when it's updated.

const ids = useSet<number>([1,2,3,4]);

return (
 <>
   {Array.from(ids, id => (
     <div>
       id: {id}. <button onClick={() => ids.delete(id)}>X</button>
     </div>
   )}
 </>
)
